page.title: 06ODDINGLEY CHURCH
page.content: {St. James Church}in{Oddingley}is situated near a few houses in the local village.The actual church is constructed on a clay base, as the soil is made of clay, and the stones are made of limestone. The Vicar lives in the neighbouring village, Tibberton.The graves are mainly old,the oldest dating from as far back as 1657.Some of the graves have no headstones,which was probably due to the fact that some families were very poor.The registers date from 1661,and these registers are preserved in the Diocesan Record Office in Worcester. The church stonework and painted glass are mainly 15th century.One window shows the conection with the{Neville family and another shows the arms of the house of{Mortimer.}There is also a memorial to the murdered rector.
